replies.body:
Hey there ChoclatePeanut,

Either stop playing Teemo altogether or literally one trick the champ until you've learnt every mechanic there is and i mean EVERY MECHANIC and EVERY MATCHUP :D

I prefer this option. 

\- [One of the top 1,000 Teemo players in the world](http://www.lolskill.net/summoner/NA/wuks)

In all seriousness, losing is part of the learning experience, as much as it does suck. From every game, focus on yourself and how you could've played it better. It doesn't necessarily need to be "How could I have carried this game?", but "How could I have completed my jungle rotations more efficiently?" is a great place to start. Before learning the macro game (taking objectives, rotations), I'd focus on the micro game. The micro game consists of your mechanics and how you react to your environment immediately; this includes last hitting, controlling your wave, kiting, and the works. Once you get a good handle on these, start looking at other lanes and see how you can start closing out the game by safely and efficiently taking out objectives or forcing fights.
